greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of product(1 + p/((p-1)^2*(p+1))), p prime >= 2).
comment: Decimal expansion of totient constant. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 20 2006
link: G. Niklasch, Some number theoretical constants: 1000-digit values [Cached copy]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Totient Summatory Function
formula: Also defined as: Sum_{m>=1} 1/(m*A000010(m)). See Weisstein link.
mathematica: LR = Join[{0, 0, 0}, LinearRecurrence[{2, -1, -1, 1}, {3, 4, 5, 3}, terms + 10]]; r[n_Integer] := LR[[n]];  (Pi^2/6)*Exp[NSum[r[n]*P[n - 1]/(n - 1), {n, 3, terms}, NSumTerms -> terms, WorkingPrecision -> digits + 10]  ] // RealDigits[#, 10, digits]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 18 2016 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 19 2001, Aug 09 2010
